page.title: 14THE WOODS
page.content: MILLOM PARK PLANTATION IS A LARGE AREA OF WOODLAND PLANTED SINCE 1950. A LOCAL FATHER AND SON HAVE PLANTED OVER HALF A MILLION TREES TO FORM THE PLANTATION AND HAVE MANAGED IT FOR THE EARL OF LONSDALE WHO OWNS THE LAND. THE TREES ARE MAINLY CONIFERS INCLUDING SPRUCE,LARCH AND PINE.THERE IS ALSO A EUCALYPTUS TREE AND ORNAMENTAL TREES LIKE RED OAK. BESIDES THE MANAGER KEEPING GOATS, GEESE AND GUINEA FOWL, AND PHEASANTS BEING BRED FOR A SHOOTING SYNDICATE, THERE IS PLENTY OF NATURAL WILDLIFE. A QUIET VISITOR MAY SEE RED DEER, ROE DEER, FOXES AND BADGERS. THERE ARE MANY BIRDS INCLUDING THE BRIGHTLY COLOURED JAY AND THE SOARING BUZZARDS. MOST VISITORS CRASHING THROUGH THE WOODS SEE NONE OF THESE.
